text: Hello team, I wish to configure the sweeping option for my Docker-based deployment.  I understood that I might need to use ad-hoc configuration (<https://docs.dev.sync.global/deployment/configuration.html#adding-ad-hoc-configuration>), but I'm unsure of how to proceed from this point. What do I need to define? Where should I define it? (in the .env file before executing the start.sh script?) Any assistance will be appreciated.

text:
Hello, I am trying to deplopy a validator node (0.4.5) on Kubernetes (on a managed AWS Postgres server), and things seem to be close to working. However, I have this issue and I cannot solve it.
*`PersistentVolumeClaim is not bound: canton/domain-migration-validator-pvc`*
 Has someone experienced the same issue and would be able to help?

text:
Hi everyone,
This is Tanya from MSE. We were recently approved and we're currently trying to set up a validator node on DevNet. We don’t have an official sponsor, but I assume the Global Synchronizer Foundation would be our sponsor in this case?

text:
<@U05KJ4MUMU2> are you using cluster Autoscaler? Could you check what zones the K8s nodes are there and the EBS of pvc is created. I believe the error you’re getting is because the zone where pvc EBS is created don’t have any K8s available nodes and it’s showing up pvc not bound error. 

Please verify if the EBS zone has any available k8s node

text:
Thanks for the update, we will move to close the related Support case.

If you experience a new technical issue, please raise a new Support request via the `<mailto:da-support@digitalasset.com|da-support@digitalasset.com>` address and ensure that you have reviewed the Canton Troubleshooting documentation and captured any relevant Docker Config and/or Logs before doing so.
